intro: Argyrocome, commonly known as silverleaf. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its silvery, hairy leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Argyrocome is native to South America and thrives in dry, arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience to harsh conditions.
